metadata.title: CVE-2020-13143 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
gadget_dev_desc_UDC_store in drivers/usb/gadget/configfs.c in the Linuxkernel 3.16 through 5.6.13 relies on kstrdup without considering thepossibility of an internal '\0' value, which allows attackers to trigger anout-of-bounds read, aka CID-15753588bcd4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-62-generic - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-62-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-62-lowlatency - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-109.110').
